intro: Angianthus brachypappus, commonly known as the narrow pappus angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
